metadata.Title: CVE-2010-5329 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The video_usercopy function in drivers/media/video/v4l2-ioctl.c in the Linux kernel before 2.6.39 relies on the count value of a v4l2_ext_controls data structure to determine a kmalloc size, which might allow local users to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a large value.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-5329` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-generic-lpae - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-lowlatency - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc-e500mc - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1

linux-image-3.19.0-18-powerpc64-smp - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-3.19.0-18-generic - 3.19.0-18.18~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1

No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support sbeattie> fixed in 2.6.39

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
